title: Daybed, 1933–1935
medium: Birch-faced plywood, tulip poplar, nickel-plated steel
provenance: 2014, acquired by Cooper Hewitt from granddaughter of original owners; commissioned from designer by original owners, Marguerita and Charles Mergentime, 1938, thence by descent to granddaughter.
description: Plywood and tulip poplar L-form headboard and side panel, each with various doors and storage compartments; bookshelf in side panel.  The whole structure mounted on tubular metal mattress support with castors; pivoting, adjustable tubular metal and wood tray/reading stand mounted on side panel. Headboard fitted with nickel-plated reading lamp with curved sheet metal shade on flexible metal neck.

tombstone.epitaph: Daybed, 1933–1935. Birch-faced plywood, tulip poplar, nickel-plated steel. Gift of Virginia Bayer. 2014-27-1-a/e.
